strategic_pillars.name: Data Center First
strategic_pillars.description: Aggressive expansion into high-performance computing (HPC) and cloud data centers with EPYC processors, capturing market share from Intel.

strategic_pillars.name: Adaptive Computing
strategic_pillars.description: Leveraging the Xilinx acquisition to dominate FPGA markets for 5G, automotive, and industrial IoT applications.

strategic_pillars.name: Gaming Leadership
strategic_pillars.description: Continued dominance in console custom silicon (PS5, Xbox) and competitive RDNA GPU architecture for PC gaming.

ai_strategy.hardware: Instinct MI300 series accelerators (CDNA 3 architecture) designed to compete directly with Nvidia H100 in training and inference workloads.
ai_strategy.software: ROCm (Radeon Open Compute) ecosystem maturity to break CUDA's moat, offering an open-source alternative for PyTorch and TensorFlow workloads.

market_risk.description: Cyclical downturn in PC client market affecting Ryzen sales.

competitive_risk.description: Nvidia's entrenched software moat (CUDA) and rapid release cadence (Blackwell) makes market penetration in AI difficult.

geopolitical_risk.description: Heavy reliance on TSMC for manufacturing exposes AMD to Taiwan Strait geopolitical tensions.
